intro: Sida kohautiana var. sampaioi, commonly known as the Sampaio's sida, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, woolly leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
